yes, luis_, but check first whether you have it by looking in applications > sound and video, or by entering "which serpentine" in a terminal
if "which serpentine" returns something like /usr/bin/serpentine then you have it already
failing that, you can easily search the repository for the actual name of the package by entering apt-cache search brasero, or apt-cache search serpentine
a handy way of checking whether you have a program installed
brasero is better for either/or audio/data, etc.
